intro: Hieracium vulgatum var. leniceps, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with basal leaves that are broadly lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers appear in late spring to early summer, and the plant produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
